comments:
Using build M20060609-1217.

I have some changes in my workspace and I want to reset them. So, in Synchronize view, I select all my changes and click on "Override and Update..." popup-menu item. Strangly, nothing happen...

Update projects (without overriding), reset perspective, exit/restart session do not fix the problem. The only workaround if found to cancel my wksp changes was to use "Replace with..." action...

Note that this problem was reproduceable after having made new changes on replaced contents...

Let me know if you need more info (the complete workpsace for example) to help you to reproduce.

Could you provide a set of steps starting from an empty workspace to produce the problem? Or, if that is not practical, can you describe the state of your workspace (i.e. how many projects in your workspace, how many projects did you sync, did you configure the sync view at all or are you using the default settings, etc)?

Unfortunately (or fortunately), this issue only occurs in one of my workspaces. I cannot reproduce neither in other existing ones nor in a brand new one.

About my workspace stats:
 - 15 projects in it (some locals, some on dev.eclipse.org, one on local
      repository)
 - 6 items in my synchronize view (dev.eclipse.org and local repositories)
 - I'm using a specific Team perspective I've renamed 'Ffr Synchronizing'
   (note that NPE also occurs if I try to 'Override and Update' in Team 
    Synchronizing perspective)

I can send my zipped workspace if this can help.
Sure, send me your workspace and I'll have a look.
First downsize severity as this issue cannot be reproduceable in any other wksp...

Created an attachment (id=45039)
Patch to protect against the NPE

I wasn't able to reproduce the problem but the it turns out top be fairly straightforward to fix. I'm attaching a patch since it should be safe to apply the fix to 3.2.1 as well.
I've released the patch to HEAD. We'll elease it to 3.2.1 once 3.2 ships.
